availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Eifort (Carter County, Kentucky, clerk and1st Lieutenant in Company C, 2nd regiment Kentucky Cavalry. )

body.p: Carter County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Ohio native. Son of Sebastian Eifort and Rachel Jackson Eifort. Clerk in Carter County, Kentucky, in 1850. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as first lieutenant, captain, major, and lieutenant colonel, from September 9, 1861, to September 3, 1864. Killed in action near Triune, Tennessee, on September 3, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 46-47, 51, 57.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 920
